title: Frontend Dependency Risk Assessment
description: Evaluates frontend dependencies for supply chain risks, including package compromise, maintenance status, and security posture.
template:
Assess dependency risk for frontend project {{project_name}}.

1. Analyze package.json and lock file
2. For each dependency, evaluate:
   - Maintenance status (last update, GitHub activity)
   - Security advisories and CVEs
   - Package popularity and trust (downloads, stars)
   - Dependency tree depth and bloat
   - License compatibility
   - Known supply chain attacks
3. Check for:
   - Typosquatting packages
   - Abandoned dependencies
   - Dependencies with single maintainer
   - Packages with postinstall scripts
4. Calculate risk score per package
5. Identify alternatives for high-risk packages
6. Recommend dependency policies
7. Set up automated monitoring

Package Manager: {{package_manager}}
Framework: {{framework}}

Output as: Risk Report | High-Risk Packages | Alternatives | Mitigation Strategy | Monitoring Setup

examples.output_outline: Risk analysis: 287 total dependencies, HIGH risk packages identified, recommendations for replacement, monitoring setup with Snyk/Socket

title: React Application Performance Audit
description: Comprehensive performance analysis for React applications, identifying re-render issues, bundle size problems, and optimization opportunities.
template:
Conduct performance audit for React application {{app_name}}.

1. Analyze component re-render patterns:
   - Unnecessary re-renders
   - Missing React.memo opportunities
   - useCallback/useMemo usage
   - Context API performance issues
2. Bundle size analysis:
   - Large dependencies
   - Code splitting opportunities
   - Tree-shaking effectiveness
   - Duplicate dependencies
3. Runtime performance:
   - Virtual DOM operations
   - Event handler efficiency
   - State management overhead
4. Loading performance:
   - Initial bundle size
   - Lazy loading implementation
   - Critical rendering path
5. Provide optimization recommendations with code examples
6. Estimate performance improvements

Current metrics: {{current_metrics}}
Target: {{performance_target}}

Output: Performance Report | Optimization Priorities | Code Examples | Implementation Roadmap

examples.output_outline: Report showing unnecessary re-renders in ProductList (40/s), large moment.js import (200KB), missing code splitting, recommendations: React.memo for product cards, replace moment with date-fns, implement route-based splitting, estimated improvements: 45% faster LCP

title: Webpack Build Configuration Optimization
description: Analyzes and optimizes Webpack configuration for faster builds, smaller bundles, and better caching strategies.
template:
Optimize Webpack configuration for {{project_name}}.

1. Review current webpack.config.js:
   - Plugin configuration
   - Loader efficiency
   - Source map strategy
   - Cache configuration
2. Analyze build performance:
   - Compilation time bottlenecks
   - Loader processing time
   - Plugin overhead
3. Bundle optimization:
   - Code splitting strategy
   - Chunk naming and hashing
   - Tree-shaking configuration
   - Minification settings
4. Development experience:
   - Hot Module Replacement
   - Incremental builds
   - Watch mode optimization
5. Production optimizations:
   - Asset optimization
   - Runtime chunk extraction
   - Vendor chunk strategy

Current build time: {{build_time}}
Webpack version: {{webpack_version}}

Output: Configuration Analysis | Optimization Recommendations | Updated Config | Performance Gains

examples.output_outline: Analysis: thread-loader could parallelize babel (save 15s), persistent caching not enabled (save 40s dev), no chunk splitting (3MB bundle), recommendations: enable cache, split vendors, use esbuild-loader, expected: 20s dev, 2m prod builds

title: Web Accessibility (WCAG) Compliance Audit
description: Comprehensive accessibility audit against WCAG guidelines, identifying violations and providing remediation guidance.
template:
Conduct accessibility audit for {{app_name}} targeting {{wcag_level}} compliance.

1. Automated testing with tools (axe, Lighthouse, WAVE):
   - Color contrast violations
   - Missing alt text
   - Form label issues
   - ARIA attribute errors
   - Keyboard navigation problems
2. Manual testing requirements:
   - Screen reader compatibility
   - Keyboard-only navigation
   - Focus management
   - Skip links and landmarks
3. Categorize issues by severity:
   - Critical (blocks usage)
   - Serious (major barriers)
   - Moderate (inconvenient)
   - Minor (best practice)
4. Provide remediation guidance:
   - Code fixes with examples
   - Design changes needed
   - Content updates required
5. Create accessibility testing strategy
6. Define ongoing compliance process

WCAG Level: {{wcag_level}}
Framework: {{framework}}

Output: Violation Report | Severity Matrix | Remediation Guide | Testing Strategy | Compliance Roadmap

examples.output_outline: Found 34 violations: 8 CRITICAL (missing form labels, insufficient contrast), 12 SERIOUS (no skip links, broken ARIA), 14 MODERATE, remediation: add aria-labels, increase contrast ratios, implement focus trap in modals, use semantic HTML, testing: integrate axe-core in CI, 3-week remediation timeline

title: CSS Architecture & Maintenance Review
description: Reviews CSS/SCSS architecture for scalability issues, specificity problems, and maintenance challenges.
template:
Review CSS architecture for {{project_name}}.

1. Analyze current CSS structure:
   - File organization and naming
   - Specificity issues and !important usage
   - Dead CSS and unused styles
   - Duplicate declarations
   - Color/spacing inconsistencies
2. Evaluate methodology:
   - BEM, SMACSS, or other conventions
   - Component scoping strategy
   - Utility class usage
3. Performance analysis:
   - CSS bundle size
   - Unused CSS
   - Critical CSS strategy
4. Maintainability assessment:
   - Magic numbers and hardcoded values
   - Theme variable usage
   - Responsive design patterns
5. Recommend improvements:
   - Architecture pattern (CSS Modules, Styled Components, Tailwind)
   - Refactoring priorities
   - Design token system

CSS approach: {{css_approach}}
Bundle size: {{css_size}}

Output: Architecture Analysis | Issues Report | Refactoring Plan | Best Practices Guide

examples.output_outline: Issues: 247 !important declarations, 35% unused CSS, no design tokens, 89 magic numbers, inconsistent spacing (12px, 15px, 16px), recommendations: implement CSS Modules, create design token system, remove unused styles (save 240KB), establish spacing scale, 6-week refactoring plan

title: Frontend State Management Optimization
description: Reviews and optimizes state management patterns, identifying over-fetching, unnecessary complexity, and performance issues.
template:
Optimize state management for {{app_name}} using {{state_library}}.

1. Audit current state structure:
   - State normalization
   - Data duplication
   - Derived state patterns
   - Global vs local state decisions
2. Identify anti-patterns:
   - Prop drilling
   - Over-normalized state
   - Missing memoization
   - Unnecessary global state
3. Performance analysis:
   - Re-render frequency
   - Selector efficiency
   - State update patterns
4. Data fetching strategy:
   - Cache management
   - Optimistic updates
   - Error handling
   - Loading states
5. Recommend improvements:
   - State structure refactoring
   - Selector optimization
   - Consider alternatives (React Query, SWR, Zustand)

State Library: {{state_library}}
Complexity: {{complexity_description}}

Output: State Audit | Performance Issues | Refactoring Plan | Migration Strategy

input.complexity_description: 300 actions, 50 reducers, API data mixed with UI state

examples.output_outline: Issues: over-fetching (same API calls multiple times), no selector memoization (20% unnecessary re-renders), mixing server/UI state, recommendations: migrate server state to React Query, keep Redux for UI-only state, implement reselect, normalize user data, estimated 40% render reduction
